verses.kjv: Then went Samson to Gaza, and saw there an harlot, and went in unto her.
verses.web: Samson went to Gaza, and saw there a prostitute, and went in to her.
verses.ct: Samson traveled to Gaza, where he saw a prostitute and slept with her.

verses.kjv: And it was told the Gazites, saying, Samson is come hither. And they compassed him in, and laid wait for him all night in the gate of the city, and were quiet all the night, saying, In the morning, when it is day, we shall kill him.
verses.web: The Gazites were told, “Samson is here!” They surrounded him and laid wait for him all night in the gate of the city, and were quiet all the night, saying, “Wait until morning light; then we will kill him.”
verses.ct: Word spread among the people of Gaza: "Samson is here!" So they surrounded the area and waited for him all night at the city gate. They stayed quiet through the night, saying, "When morning comes, we'll kill him."

verses.kjv: And Samson lay till midnight, and arose at midnight, and took the doors of the gate of the city, and the two posts, and went away with them, bar and all, and put them upon his shoulders, and carried them up to the top of an hill that is before Hebron.
verses.web: Samson lay until midnight, then arose at midnight and took hold of the doors of the gate of the city, with the two posts, and plucked them up, bar and all, and put them on his shoulders and carried them up to the top of the mountain that is before Hebron.
verses.ct: But Samson only stayed until midnight. Then he got up, grabbed the doors of the city gate along with both posts, and ripped them out of the ground — bar and all. He hoisted them onto his shoulders and carried them to the top of the hill that faces Hebron.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass afterward, that he loved a woman in the valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah.
verses.web: It came to pass afterward that he loved a woman in the valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah.
verses.ct: Some time later, Samson fell in love with a woman named Delilah, who lived in the valley of Sorek.

verses.kjv: And the lords of the Philistines came up unto her, and said unto her, Entice him, and see wherein his great strength lieth, and by what means we may prevail against him, that we may bind him to afflict him: and we will give thee every one of us eleven hundred pieces of silver.
verses.web: The lords of the Philistines came up to her and said to her, “Entice him, and see in which his great strength lies, and by what means we may prevail against him, that we may bind him to afflict him; and we will each give you eleven hundred pieces of silver.”
verses.ct: The Philistine rulers went to her and said, "Seduce him and find out where his incredible strength comes from. Figure out how we can overpower him so we can tie him up and make him helpless. Each of us will give you 1,100 pieces of silver."

verses.kjv: And Delilah said to Samson, Tell me, I pray thee, wherein thy great strength lieth, and wherewith thou mightest be bound to afflict thee.
verses.web: Delilah said to Samson, “Please tell me where your great strength lies, and what you might be bound to afflict you.”
verses.ct: So Delilah said to Samson, "Tell me — where does your amazing strength come from? How could someone tie you up and overpower you?"

verses.kjv: And Samson said unto her, If they bind me with seven green withs that were never dried, then shall I be weak, and be as another man.
verses.web: Samson said to her, “If they bind me with seven green cords that were never dried, then shall I become weak, and be as another man.”
verses.ct: Samson told her, "If they tie me up with 7 fresh bowstrings that haven't been dried out, I'll become as weak as any ordinary man."

verses.kjv: Then the lords of the Philistines brought up to her seven green withs which had not been dried, and she bound him with them.
verses.web: Then the lords of the Philistines brought up to her seven green cords which had not been dried, and she bound him with them.
verses.ct: So the Philistine rulers brought her 7 fresh bowstrings that hadn't been dried, and she tied him up with them.

verses.kjv: Now there were men lying in wait, abiding with her in the chamber. And she said unto him, The Philistines be upon thee, Samson. And he brake the withs, as a thread of tow is broken when it toucheth the fire. So his strength was not known.
verses.web: Now she had an ambush waiting in the inner room. She said to him, “The Philistines are on you, Samson!” He broke the cords as a flax thread is broken when it touches the fire. So his strength was not known.
verses.ct: She had men hiding in the inner room, ready to ambush him. Then she shouted, "The Philistines are here, Samson!" But he snapped the bowstrings like a thread touching a flame — they broke apart instantly. So the secret of his strength remained unknown.

verses.kjv: And Delilah said unto Samson, Behold, thou hast mocked me, and told me lies: now tell me, I pray thee, wherewith thou mightest be bound.
verses.web: Delilah said to Samson, “Behold, you have mocked me, and told me lies. Now please tell me how you might be bound.”
verses.ct: Delilah said to Samson, "You made a fool of me! You lied to me! Now please, tell me the truth — how could someone tie you up?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, If they bind me fast with new ropes that never were occupied, then shall I be weak, and be as another man.
verses.web: He said to her, “If they only bind me with new ropes with which no work has been done, then shall I become weak, and be as another man.”
verses.ct: He told her, "If they tie me tightly with brand-new ropes that have never been used, I'll become as weak as any ordinary man."

verses.kjv: Delilah therefore took new ropes, and bound him therewith, and said unto him, The Philistines be upon thee, Samson. And there were liers in wait abiding in the chamber. And he brake them from off his arms like a thread.
verses.web: So Delilah took new ropes and bound him with them, then said to him, “The Philistines are on you, Samson!” The ambush was waiting in the inner room. He broke them off his arms like a thread.
verses.ct: So Delilah took new ropes and tied him up with them. Then she shouted, "The Philistines are here, Samson!" Again, men were hiding in the inner room. But he snapped the ropes off his arms like they were thread.

verses.kjv: And Delilah said unto Samson, Hitherto thou hast mocked me, and told me lies: tell me wherewith thou mightest be bound. And he said unto her, If thou weavest the seven locks of my head with the web.
verses.web: Delilah said to Samson, “Until now, you have mocked me and told me lies. Tell me with what you might be bound.” He said to her, “If you weave the seven locks of my head with the fabric on the loom.”
verses.ct: Delilah said to Samson, "You keep making a fool of me and telling me lies! Tell me how you could really be tied up." He said to her, "If you weave the 7 braids of my hair into the fabric on your loom."

verses.kjv: And she fastened it with the pin, and said unto him, The Philistines be upon thee, Samson. And he awaked out of his sleep, and went away with the pin of the beam, and with the web.
verses.web: She fastened it with the pin, and said to him, “The Philistines are on you, Samson!” He awakened out of his sleep, and plucked away the pin of the beam and the fabric.
verses.ct: So she wove his hair in and pinned it tight with the loom pin. Then she shouted, "The Philistines are here, Samson!" He woke up from his sleep and yanked his hair free, pulling out the pin and the fabric with it.

verses.kjv: And she said unto him, How canst thou say, I love thee, when thine heart is not with me? thou hast mocked me these three times, and hast not told me wherein thy great strength lieth.
verses.web: She said to him, “How can you say, ‘I love you,’ when your heart is not with me? You have mocked me these three times, and have not told me where your great strength lies.”
verses.ct: Then she said to him, "How can you say 'I love you' when you don't trust me with the truth? You've made a fool of me 3 times now and still haven't told me where your great strength comes from."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when she pressed him daily with her words, and urged him, so that his soul was vexed unto death;
verses.web: When she pressed him daily with her words and urged him, his soul was troubled to death.
verses.ct: Day after day she pressured him with her words and nagged him relentlessly, until his soul was worn down to the breaking point.

verses.kjv: That he told her all his heart, and said unto her, There hath not come a razor upon mine head; for I have been a Nazarite unto God from my mother’s womb: if I be shaven, then my strength will go from me, and I shall become weak, and be like any other man.
verses.web: He told her all his heart and said to her, “No razor has ever come on my head; for I have been a Nazirite to God from my mother’s womb. If I am shaved, then my strength will go from me and I will become weak, and be like any other man.”
verses.ct: Finally, he told her everything. "No razor has ever touched my head," he said, "because I've been set apart as a Nazirite to God since before I was born. If my head is shaved, my strength will leave me, and I'll become as weak as any other man."

verses.kjv: And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart, she sent and called for the lords of the Philistines, saying, Come up this once, for he hath shewed me all his heart. Then the lords of the Philistines came up unto her, and brought money in their hand.
verses.web: When Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart, she sent and called for the lords of the Philistines, saying, “Come up this once, for he has told me all his heart.” Then the lords of the Philistines came up to her and brought the money in their hand.
verses.ct: When Delilah realized he had finally told her the whole truth, she sent a message to the Philistine rulers: "Come back one more time — he's told me everything." So the Philistine rulers came to her, bringing the silver with them.

verses.kjv: And she made him sleep upon her knees; and she called for a man, and she caused him to shave off the seven locks of his head; and she began to afflict him, and his strength went from him.
verses.web: She made him sleep on her knees; and she called for a man and shaved off the seven locks of his head; and she began to afflict him, and his strength went from him.
verses.ct: She lulled Samson to sleep with his head on her lap, then called in a man to shave off the 7 braids from his head. She began to torment him, and his strength drained away.

verses.kjv: And she said, The Philistines be upon thee, Samson. And he awoke out of his sleep, and said, I will go out as at other times before, and shake myself. And he wist not that the LORD was departed from him.
verses.web: She said, “The Philistines are upon you, Samson!” He awoke out of his sleep, and said, “I will go out as at other times, and shake myself free.” But he didn’t know that LORD had departed from him.
verses.ct: She shouted, "The Philistines are here, Samson!" He woke up and thought, "I'll break free just like before." But he didn't know that the LORD had left him.

verses.kjv: But the Philistines took him, and put out his eyes, and brought him down to Gaza, and bound him with fetters of brass; and he did grind in the prison house.
verses.web: The Philistines laid hold on him and put out his eyes; and they brought him down to Gaza and bound him with fetters of bronze; and he ground at the mill in the prison.
verses.ct: The Philistines seized him, gouged out his eyes, and dragged him down to Gaza. They bound him with bronze shackles and forced him to grind grain in the prison.

verses.kjv: Howbeit the hair of his head began to grow again after he was shaven.
verses.web: However, the hair of his head began to grow again after he was shaved.
verses.ct: But his hair began to grow back after it had been shaved.

verses.kjv: Then the lords of the Philistines gathered them together for to offer a great sacrifice unto Dagon their god, and to rejoice: for they said, Our god hath delivered Samson our enemy into our hand.
verses.web: The lords of the Philistines gathered together to offer a great sacrifice to Dagon their god, and to rejoice; for they said, “Our god has delivered Samson our enemy into our hand.”
verses.ct: The Philistine rulers gathered for a great celebration to offer a massive sacrifice to their god Dagon. They declared, "Our god has handed Samson, our enemy, over to us!"

verses.kjv: And when the people saw him, they praised their god: for they said, Our god hath delivered into our hands our enemy, and the destroyer of our country, which slew many of us.
verses.web: When the people saw him, they praised their god; for they said, “Our god has delivered our enemy and the destroyer of our country, who has slain many of us, into our hand.”
verses.ct: When the people saw Samson, they praised their god, saying, "Our god has delivered our enemy to us — the one who destroyed our land and killed so many of our people!"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when their hearts were merry, that they said, Call for Samson, that he may make us sport. And they called for Samson out of the prison house; and he made them sport: and they set him between the pillars.
verses.web: When their hearts were merry, they said, “Call for Samson, that he may entertain us.” They called for Samson out of the prison; and he performed before them. They set him between the pillars;
verses.ct: As the celebration grew wilder and their spirits rose, they shouted, "Bring out Samson so he can entertain us!" So they brought Samson out of the prison, and he performed for them. Then they stood him between the main pillars of the temple.

verses.kjv: And Samson said unto the lad that held him by the hand, Suffer me that I may feel the pillars whereupon the house standeth, that I may lean upon them.
verses.web: and Samson said to the boy who held him by the hand, “Allow me to feel the pillars on which the house rests, that I may lean on them.”
verses.ct: Samson said to the boy who was leading him by the hand, "Let me touch the pillars that hold up this building so I can lean against them."

verses.kjv: Now the house was full of men and women; and all the lords of the Philistines were there; and there were upon the roof about three thousand men and women, that beheld while Samson made sport.
verses.web: Now the house was full of men and women; and all the lords of the Philistines were there; and there were on the roof about three thousand men and women, who saw while Samson performed.
verses.ct: The temple was packed with men and women. All the Philistine rulers were there, and about 3,000 more men and women were crowded on the roof, watching Samson perform.

verses.kjv: And Samson called unto the LORD, and said, O Lord God, remember me, I pray thee, and strengthen me, I pray thee, only this once, O God, that I may be at once avenged of the Philistines for my two eyes.
verses.web: Samson called to LORD, and said, “Lord LORD, remember me, please, and strengthen me, please, only this once, God, that I may be at once avenged of the Philistines for my two eyes.”
verses.ct: Then Samson cried out to the LORD, "Lord GOD, please remember me. Strengthen me just one more time, God, so I can pay back the Philistines for taking my 2 eyes."

verses.kjv: And Samson took hold of the two middle pillars upon which the house stood, and on which it was borne up, of the one with his right hand, and of the other with his left.
verses.web: Samson took hold of the two middle pillars on which the house rested and leaned on them, the one with his right hand and the other with his left.
verses.ct: Samson reached out and gripped the 2 central pillars that supported the entire building — his right hand on one and his left hand on the other.

verses.kjv: And Samson said, Let me die with the Philistines. And he bowed himself with all his might; and the house fell upon the lords, and upon all the people that were therein. So the dead which he slew at his death were more than they which he slew in his life.
verses.web: Samson said, “Let me die with the Philistines!” He bowed himself with all his might; and the house fell on the lords, and on all the people who were in it. So the dead that he killed at his death were more than those who he killed in his life.
verses.ct: Samson shouted, "Let me die with the Philistines!" Then he pushed with everything he had. The temple came crashing down on the rulers and everyone inside. He killed more people in his death than he had killed in his entire life.

verses.kjv: Then his brethren and all the house of his father came down, and took him, and brought him up, and buried him between Zorah and Eshtaol in the buryingplace of Manoah his father. And he judged Israel twenty years.
verses.web: Then his brothers and all the house of his father came down and took him, and brought him up and buried him between Zorah and Eshtaol in the burial site of Manoah his father. He judged Israel twenty years.
verses.ct: His brothers and the rest of his father's family came down to get him. They carried his body back and buried him between Zorah and Eshtaol, in the tomb of his father Manoah. Samson had led Israel for 20 years.
